text: Snapchat is a mobile app that allows users
to easily share photos and videos
with friends and public audiences.

What sets Snapchat apart
from other social apps
is that photos and videos

can be set to disappear
after being viewed.
Here's a quick tour of the app.
The icons at the bottom of the screen
indicate the different features
that you can explore in Snapchat.

The Snap Map shows where
your friends on Snapchat
are currently located
if they have that function turned on.

You can also explore
different locations on the map

and watch Snaps that people
share publicly in each location.

The chat tab shows all of
the snaps that you receive.

You can add friends in this tab
by tapping on the plus icon.

The camera icon will give
you access to your camera.

Here, you can take a photo
or video to send to others.

There are various
filters that can be used,

as well as the option to draw
on the image and add text.

Filters will vary based
on your current location.
To set a duration on your snap,

tap on the stopwatch icon
on the right of screen
and choose the desired duration.

The stories tab allows you to
watch your friends' stories.

Stories are comprised
of a series of snaps.
They can be a mix of photos and videos.

Under "Discover," you
can watch public stories
curated by Snapchat.
Tap on the right side of the screen
to move forward through the stories.

Finally, the spotlight tab
features short video content
that you can scroll through by swiping up
or tapping on the screen.
These videos are all public

and have genuinely amassed
a large number of views.
Tap the heart icon to like a video.
